document_title: Maxillary sinusitis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: viem-xoang-ham.json_2_What is the cause of maxillary sinusitis?
subsection_content:
According to MSc. Huynh Thanh Kieu, there are many causes of maxillary sinusitis, such as:
Prolonged allergic rhinitis. Deviated nasal septum structure. There are diseases related to teeth. Changes in weather and environment; Bacteria from outside enter the body. Trauma due to accident, or surgery (tooth extraction, oral cavity surgery).; Persistent allergic rhinitis; Deviated nasal septum structure; There are diseases related to teeth; Changes in weather and environment; Bacteria from outside enter the body; Trauma caused by an accident or surgery (tooth extraction, oral cavity surgery).
